subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text:
* In Taiwan and Hong Kong, the upper component of this character is <font size=5>[[⻀]]</font> (ram's horn), which is the original form found in the {{w|Shuowen Jiezi}} dictionary.
* In mainland China, the upper component of this character is <font size=4>{{l|mul|艹}}</font> (grass radical) which is the same form found in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}.

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: This character is not to be confused with visually similar {{l|mul|莧}} (U+83A7) which is based on the grass radical and does not have an additional {{l|mul|丶}} dot in the component {{l|mul|見}}.

subSections.title: Derived characters
subSections.text:
* <big>{{l|mul|[[𦏊]], [[𡅽]], [[寬]], [[𡅻]]}}</big> ''(Contains <font size=5>[[⻀]]</font> <small>(ram's horn)</small> for Taiwan/Hong Kong and <font size=4>{{l|mul|艹}}</font> <small>(grass radical)</small> for mainland China and other regions)''
* <big>{{l|mul|[[𬪖]]}}</big> ''(Contains <font size=4>{{l|mul|艹}}</font> grass radical)''
* <big>{{l|mul|[[𬉛]]}}</big> ''(Contains <font size=5>[[⻀]]</font> ram's horn)''

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{liushu|p}} – a goat, showing its horns, head, legs and tail. ''{{w|Shuowen}}'' erroneously considers it to be a {{Han compound|𥄕||ls=psc|c1=p|c2=s|t2=legs of a rabbit|nocap=1}}.
